instruction: If it takes 5 machines 5 minutes to make 5 gadgets, how long would 100 machines take to make 100 gadgets?
Which is heavier, a pound of feathers or a pound of gold?
What can travel around the world while staying in the same corner?
Before Mt. Everest was discovered, what was the highest mountain on Earth?
output: Mt. Everest, it just wasn’t discovered yet.

instruction: You see a boat filled with people. It hasn’t sunk, but when you look again you don’t see a single person. Why?
What has keys but can't open locks?
What has hands but can't clap?
If two's company and three's a crowd, what are four and five?
I am an odd number. Take away one letter and I become even. What am I?
What begins with T, ends with T, and has T in it?
The more of me you take, the more you leave behind. What am I?
If you throw a red stone into the blue sea, what will it become?
What has one eye but can't see?
Forward I am heavy, but backward I am not. What am I?
Which month has 28 days?
output: All of them have at least 28 days.

instruction: You answer me, although I never ask you questions. What am I?
What comes once in a minute, twice in a moment, but never in a thousand years?
If a plane crashes on the border of the U.S. and Canada, where do they bury the survivors?
If there are three apples and you take away two, how many apples do you have?
What word is spelled incorrectly in every dictionary?
What gets wetter the more it dries?
You spot a boat full of people but there isn’t a single person on board. How?
I speak without a mouth and hear without ears. What am I?
What has many teeth but can't bite?
What can you catch but not throw?
What has a head, a tail, but no body?
David’s father has three sons: Snap, Crackle, and ___?
What can fill a room but takes up no space?
The more you take, the more you leave behind. What are they?
What begins with an E but only has one letter in it?
How can a man go eight days without sleep?
If there are 12 fish and half of them drown, how many are left?
What has legs but doesn’t walk?
What runs but never walks, has a bed but never sleeps?
You can break me easily without touching me or seeing me. What am I?
What can be cracked, made, told, and played?
If you have me, you want to share me. If you share me, you don't have me. What am I?
If an electric train is moving north at 100mph and a wind is blowing east at 10mph, which way does the smoke blow?
What comes down but never goes up?
I’m tall when I’m young, and I’m short when I’m old. What am I?
What can you hold in your left hand but not in your right?
A cowboy rode into town on Friday. He stayed three nights and left on Friday. How is this possible?
What has cities, but no houses; forests, but no trees; and rivers, but no water?
What is always in front of you but can't be seen?
A girl has as many brothers as sisters, but each brother has only half as many brothers as sisters. How many brothers and sisters are there?
What disappears as soon as you say its name?
I have branches but no fruit, trunk or leaves. What am I?
What goes up but never comes down?
If Mrs. John’s one-story house is decorated completely in pink, with the walls, carpet, and furniture all shades of pink, what color are the stairs?
output: There are no stairs, it’s a one-story house.

instruction: If you have one match and enter a dark room containing an oil lamp, some kindling wood, and a newspaper, which do you light first?
How many seconds are there in one and a half minutes?
How can you drop a raw egg onto a concrete floor without cracking it?
output: Concrete floors are hard to crack.

instruction: What begins with P, ends with E, and has thousands of letters?
What starts with a P, ends with an E, and has a million letters in it?
If you have it, you want to share it. If you share it, you haven't got it. What is it?
A truck driver is going down a one-way street the wrong way, but he passes at least ten cops and isn't caught. Why?
What can one catch that is not thrown?
How many times can you subtract 5 from 25?
output: Only once, because after that you are subtracting 5 from 20.

instruction: What invention lets you look right through a wall?
The more you take away from me, the bigger I get. What am I?
What five-letter word becomes shorter when you add two letters to it?
What runs all around a backyard, yet never moves?
If an airplane crashes exactly on the border of two countries, where do they bury the survivors?
What has four wheels and flies?
Which is correct to say: 'The yolk of the egg are white' or 'The yolk of the egg is white'?
What can run but never walks, has a mouth but never talks, and has a bed but never sleeps?
What word is always spelled incorrectly?
A man shaves several times a day, yet he still has a beard. How?
You see me once in June, twice in November, but not at all in May. What am I?
Which weighs more, a ton of bricks or a ton of feathers?
output: Neither. They both weigh the same.

instruction: What begins with an E, ends with an E, and contains only one letter?
A rooster lays an egg on a barn roof. Which way does it roll?
What two things can you never eat for breakfast?
I am full of holes but I can still hold water. What am I?
If there are six apples and you take away four, how many do you have?
What gets bigger the more you take away?
What can’t talk but will reply when spoken to?
I have keys but no locks. I have a space but no room. You can enter but you can't go outside. What am I?
Where does Friday come before Thursday?
If you drop a yellow hat into the Red Sea, what does it become?
If you have three, you have three. If you have two, you have two. But if you have one, you have none. What are they?
What occurs once in a year, twice in a week, but never in a day?
I’m light as a feather, yet the strongest man can’t hold me for more than 5 minutes. What am I?
What has one head, one foot, and four legs?
If there are four apples and you take away three, how many do you have?
What gets sharper the more you use it?
What is as light as a feather, yet even the world’s strongest man couldn’t hold it for much longer than a minute?
What has an endless supply of letters but starts empty?
What has 13 hearts, but no other organs?
Where can you find cities, streets, and shops but no people?
What has a bottom at the top?
What is bought by the yard and worn by the foot?
What belongs to you but other people use it more than you do?
What has four fingers and a thumb but is not alive?
How many times can you subtract 2 from 10?
output: Once. After that, you're subtracting 2 from 8.

instruction: What is always running but never moves?
What has no beginning, end, or middle?
What can be cracked, made, told, and played?
What comes once in a second, twice in a decade, but not once in a century?
If an electric train is moving west at 90mph and the wind is blowing east at 100mph, which way does the smoke blow?
